title: AB 873
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 9880.1 of the Business and Professions Code is amended to define key terms related to automotive repair, including "automotive repair dealer," "chief," "bureau," and "motor vehicle." The definition of "repair of motor vehicles" by an automotive repair dealer includes all maintenance and repairs, excluding certain minor services determined by the director. No service can be considered minor if it requires mechanical expertise, has a history of fraud, or involves a crucial part of the vehicle for safe operation. An "automotive technician" is defined as an employee of an automotive repair dealer who performs maintenance, diagnostics, repair, removal, or installation of integral component parts of a vehicle, excluding certain minor services. "Person" includes various entities like firms, partnerships, associations, LLCs, or corporations. The "Director" refers to the Director of Consumer Affairs. The "Director" is the Director of Consumer Affairs. A "Commercial business agreement" is an agreement between a business and an automobile repair dealer for ongoing repairs. A "Customer" is the person authorizing repairs on a motor vehicle, excluding the repair dealer, insurer, or their representatives. Prior to January 1, 2018, the director will define "minor services." This section is effective until January 1, 2018. Section 9880.1 of the Business and Professions Code defines terms like "automotive repair dealer" and "motor vehicle." The definition of "repair of motor vehicles" includes all maintenance and repairs performed by an automotive repair dealer, excluding certain repairs and roadside services. A "person" can be a firm, partnership, association, LLC, or corporation. An "automotive technician" is an employee who repairs motor vehicles for a salary or wage. The "Director" refers to the Director of Consumer Affairs. A "Commercial business agreement" is an agreement between a business and an automobile repair dealer for ongoing vehicle repairs, excluding warranties or service agreements. Roadside services involve performing services on a motor vehicle for transportation or to enable it to operate, by a motor club or tow truck operator with specific certifications and permits. The definition of "Customer" is clarified as the person authorizing repairs on a motor vehicle, excluding the repair dealer, insurer, or their representatives. Regulations on "minor services" will remain in effect until January 1, 2018, with the director having the authority to amend them. This section will be effective on January 1, 2018. This section will become operative on January 1, 2018. No reimbursement is required by this act as it pertains to creating, eliminating, or changing penalties for crimes or infractions. This act will only become effective if Senate Bill 778 of the 2015–16 Regular Session is enacted by January 1, 2017.
